entry.title: 523: Scooby-Doo of Code Hiding
entry.summary: We open the robe and spend a little time chatting about the software development business.

entry.title: 515: Ham Sandwich
entry.summary: Is Ham Radio a natural hobby for Linux users? An old friend joins us to explain where the two overlap. Special Guest: Noah Chelliah.

entry.title: Linux Action News 297
entry.summary: What we really like in Debian 12, the big players backing RISC-V, and the improvements in NextCloud Hub 5. Note: Linux Action News will be off next week.

entry.title: 522: Reddit Goes Dark
entry.summary: We chew on the ridiculous situation Reddit has created for itself and the weak position of app developers.

entry.title: 514: Connection Established
entry.summary: We get the inside scoop on SouthEast LinuxFest, and share a few stories from the early days of the Linux community. Special Guest: Noah Chelliah.

entry.title: Linux Action News 296
entry.summary: Ubuntu gets serious about the immutable desktop, red flags from Red Hat, and the little tricks Apple used to patch Wine.

entry.title: 521: More Pro, More Problems
entry.summary: We argue over what sucked the most at WWDC this year and then surprise each other with two things that thrill us.

entry.title: 513: There Is No Distro
entry.summary: We attempt to swap Linux distributions live on our production server, to prove that new tooling makes the Linux distro model obsolete.

entry.title: Linux Action News 295
entry.summary: How the recent XFS bug was squashed, insights into why Microsoft built their own Linux from scratch, and recent attacks on Archive.org.

entry.title: 520: Microsoft Goes All-In
entry.summary: We chew on the best bits from this year's Microsoft Build and the bright red flag coming from the Rust community.

entry.title: 512: The Sound of Rust
entry.summary: We take a "Rust-only tools" challenge for a week and admit what worked, and what sucked. Plus, a surprise guest.
